citeinfo.origin: Sir Alister Hardy Foundation for Ocean Science
citeinfo.title: Continuous Plankton Recorder Data

descript.abstract:
The Continuous Plankton Recorder is towed on a transect from Alaska to California (until 2004) or to Puget Sound (from 2004). The transect is sampled between 5 and 7 times per year. The transect is divided up into discrete plankton samples, each 18kms long. Every fourth collected sample (and every sequential Alaskan shelf sample) is processed for hard-shelled phytoplankton and mesozooplankton (principally crustacea). Organisms are identified to the highest practicable taxonomic level and levels of abundance are recorded for each taxon. All samples are archived. The data are stored as counts of each taxon together with time, date and location of collection of the mid-point of the sample.
Please also see Metadata ID 2015 for another north Pacific CPR project.
[ An EVOS GEM project ]
descript.purpose: Data were collected to provide baseline information of plankton populations on large spatial scales, and to monitor the distributions through time.

idinfo.useconst: Acknowledgement of data source publication required.

distinfo.distliab: While every effort has been made to ensure that these data are accurate and reliable within the limits of the current state of the art, NOAA cannot assume liability for any damages caused by any errors or omissions in the data, nor as a result of the failure of the data to function on a particular system. NOAA makes no warranty, expressed or implied, nor does the fact of distribution constitute such a warranty.
